comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.youtube.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2F) ### Comment Username: @MojoZone9 > I can go to YouTube's home page and it works just fine. When I enter anything into the search bar, most of the page gets blocked. I had gone into AdGuard when the issue was first noticed and deleted a YouTube user rule. Afterward, YouTube worked perfectly. Later that day, the problem arose again. I have deleted all user rules for YouTube and the problem still persists. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
In general please disable the non-required lists as they are already included in another enabled list:
EasyList
AdGuard Mobile App Banners
AdGuard Widgets
AdGuard Cookie Notices
AdGuard Other Annoyances
AdGuard Popups

2nd please try without DNS protection. Also you have enabled a lot of third-party filters which can cause such issues (Peter Lowe's Blocklist is known to cause issues). With AdGuard only filters I cannot reproduce.

Self-destructing third-party cookies (0) can also cause some issues.

comment.body:
Not reproduced this with our filters, `EasyList Czech and Slovak` with a Czech IP on my end.
Try to leave only them, clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
Если проблема повторяется, попробуйте оставить только наши фильтры.
Далее отключайте их по одному до выявления проблемного, но если все по-прежнему, отключите их все и оставьте активной защиту в приложении.

comment.body:
>you don't need to care about what filters i use, its not related to the issue

It's relevant circa 90% of the time, but I guess it's fair enough to omit them for entry submissions to specific lists, in this case to AdGuard Tracking Protection.

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/371

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, you’re probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

comment.body:
> EasyList (and thus AdGuard Base) has `##.ad-bottom-container`, which is on paper supposed to fix it.

Adguard Android uses Adguard Base Optimized filter. Looks like optimized filter doesn't have this rule. Maybe it needs to be added to the optimized filter to make it workable on Android.

This issue has been escalated to [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra):
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/375

Please wait until it is solved there.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, you’re probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.livejournal.com/ratings/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.livejournal.com%2Fratings%2F) ### Comment > Добрый день! Adguard стал пропускать рекламу в Живом Журнале. Очень много рекламы от Сбера, но и другие объявления тоже попадаются. Началось где-то около месяца назад (октябрь 2022). comment.body:
Bonjour

you can use CSS-rules for instance:

`gleeden.com#$#.content-container { min-height: none!important; filter: none!important; pointer-events: auto!important; }`

https://kb.adguard.com/en/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters#cosmetic-css-rules

comment.body:
Hi there. I really appreciate the assistance. Is everyone testing this on iOS 16.1, using Safari, on m.Facebook.com? With anything other than the default AdGuard settings? I cleared the cache/cookies. That got rid of the images for the “sponsored” posts, but I still get these in the attached image, and the website still bounces around while scrolling. It has been acting like this since AdGuard 4.4.4 for  iOS was released, and nothing I’ve seen suggested, nor the suggestions from AdGuard support have fixed the issue. That’s why they directed me here. Thank you, again, for your assistance. 
![EAF665B1-EAAA-4D00-AFCC-AE91F194A2FF](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/116531838/201375460-8ac396ad-f8c3-477f-9ea9-09ddabba2a21.jpeg)
